pageContext.claim: “We're doing a great job. We have 40 people [dead] right now. Forty. Compare that with other countries that have many, many times that amount.”
pageContext.analysis: Against all medical evidence, Trump was fooling himself here -- and misleading the public. The virus had been spreading quickly through the United States and the caseload and death toll was about to explode. Trump only two weeks earlier had bragged about just 15 cases and no deaths. Now he was citing just 40 deaths because of the case load had jumped above 2,200. By March 31, there were almost 3,800 deaths from covid-19 recorded in the USA. The United States would have the highest number of recorded deaths in the world by April 11, less than a month after these comments.
